I would highly recommend "The Man on Wire" (2008) to anyone who enjoys a thrilling and suspenseful movie.
The story revolves around Philippe Petit, a tightrope walker, who performs an illegal high-wire routine between the twin towers of New York City' s World Trade Center in 1974.
The movie follows Petit's journey from his childhood in Alsace, France to his adult years as a tightrope walker.
The movie also explores Petit's thoughts and feelings about performing an illegal high-wire routine between the twin towers of New York City' s World Trade Center in 1974.
Overall, "The Man on Wire" is a highly recommended movie for anyone who enjoys a thrilling and suspenseful movie.

"The Last Samurai" is a 2003 American historical drama film directed by Rob Reiner. The film stars Tom Cruise, Sophia Longoria-Terry, and Takeo Yamada.

"The Last Samurai" tells the story of Kiyoshi Motonaga (Tom Cruise), a samurai who becomes disillusioned with his role in society. Motonaga begins to question the morality of his actions as he witnesses firsthand the corruption and oppression that permeate Japanese society.Motonaga eventually renounces his samurai rank and returns to the fold of ordinary Japanese citizens.
